entries: You have direct access to higher echelons of your organisation. You gain an expertise die on Persuasion checks.

entries.name: Contingency Planning
entries: Your experience with politics and intrigue has been quite rigorous. You gain resistance to poison damage and can add your Wisdom modifier to saving throws you make to resist being poisoned.

entries.name: False Pretense
entries: You gain an expertise die on Deception checks.

subclassFeature.name: Decisive Mind
entries: At 11th level you gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Riding Out
entries: At 15th level when you use any combat maneuver that requires you to be mounted you only expend half the exertion (rounded up).
In addition, you gain the {@spell Ride Enemy|LevelUpA5E} combat maneuver. It does not count against your number of maneuvers known, and you do not have to expend exertion points to activate it.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: When you reach 3rd level, your deep connection to nature grants you the ability to cast spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 3rd level, you know two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter druid spell list|spells|class=druid}. These spells count as ranger spells for you. You learn an additional cantrip at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Wildborn Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your {@filter spells|spells|class=druid} of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell animal friendship} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell animal friendship} using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know three 1st-level spells of your choice from the {@filter druid spell list|spells|class=druid}.

The Spells Known column of the Wildborn Spellcasting table shows when you learn more spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the spells you know and replace it with another spell from the druid spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your spells, since your magic draws on your attunement to nature. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Nature's Wellspring
entries: At 7th level, you gain one of the following features.

entries.name: Magical Intuition
entries: You can cast {@spell detect magic|LevelUpA5E} at will, without expending a spell slot.

entries.name: Magical Weapons
entries: Your weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Overcome Magic
entries: You gain an expertise die on saving throws made against spells and other magical effects.

subclassFeature.name: Hardy Resilience
entries: At 11th level, you gain proficiency in Constitution saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Naturally Attuned
entries: At 15th level, you gain one of the following features.

entries.name: Magical Abundance
entries: You can attune to 1 additional magic item at once.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries: You gain advantage on saving throws made against spells and other magical effects.

subclassFeature.name: Pierce the Dark
entries: At 3rd level, your senses sharpen to allow you to perceive your lightless environment. If you have the ability to see, you gain darkvision to a range of 120 feet and the ability to see through magical darkness. If you have blindsight, the range of your blindsight increases by 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Embrace the Dark
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you can enshroud yourself in darkness. As an action, you can activate your shroud of darkness. Your shroud remains active for 1 hour, until you fall {@condition unconscious}, or until you use a bonus action to deactivate it. While your shroud is active, light within 30 feet decreases from bright light to dim light, from dim light to darkness, or from darkness to magical darkness. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Wield the Dark
entries: Starting at 7th level, when you start your turn in an area of darkness or magical darkness, you gain a Darkness die, a {@dice d6}. You can have only one Darkness die at a time. At any time, you can roll your Darkness die and apply the result to one of the following: your AC against one attack made by a creature you can see, an attack or damage roll you make with a weapon, or a Stealth skill check. You can apply your Darkness die even after making an attack roll or after the result of a creature's attack roll is declared.
At 15th level, your Darkness die increases to a {@dice d8}.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Resolve
entries: At 11th level, you gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Call the Dark
entries: At 15th level, you can summon darkness at will. You can use a bonus action to cast the {@spell darkness|LevelUpA5E} spell without components. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Beast Friend
entries: After a Befriend Creature journey activity, you can befriend and feed a {@filter Medium or smaller beast of CR 1/8 or less|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1/8]|type=beast|size=t;s;m}, becoming its guardian ranger. It follows you and is loyal to you, but it acts independently. In combat, it rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn. The beast won't attack except as a response to being attacked, but it can take other actions as normal and makes death saving throws. You can only be a guardian ranger to one beast at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Build Shelter
entries: You can change a failure or worse on a Seek Shelter journey activity check into a success.
Once you have used this feature, you cannot do so again for a week.

optionalfeature.name: Calls of the Wild
entries: Using verbal and nonverbal cues to communicate with beasts, you can gain basic information from them or make a simple request (like delivering a shrot message or small object).

optionalfeature.name: Ear to the Ground
entries: By expending 1 minute remaining stationary, using sound a vibrations alone, until you move or take an action you are able to deduce information for up to 30' in every direction, as if using blindsight or tremorsense.

optionalfeature.name: Expert Foraging
entries: After a Harvest journey activity, you can collect a number of edible, non-poisonous plants and grubs equal to your proficiency bonus. A creature can use its action to eat up to 5 plants or grubs, each of which restores 1 hit point. A creature who eats at least 1 also recovers 1 level of fatigue, but can only benefit from this once per long rest. The plants and grubs die and spoil 1 hour after being collected.

optionalfeature.name: Forced Marcher
entries: The journeys your party undertake are reduced in length by 1 day, to a minimum of 1 day.

optionalfeature.name: Guide
entries: While traveling, when you would have a failure or worse for a Scout journey activity, you succeed instead, and you can Scout in addition to engaging in any other journey activity.

optionalfeature.name: Healing Salves
entries: On a success or higher on a Harvest journey activity, you can collect natural ingredients and concoct an ointment that speeds healing. This salve is potent for 24 hours and has a number of uses equal to 1 + your Wisdom modifier. As an action, you can use the salve to restore 1d4 hit points to a creature within reach.

optionalfeature.name: Herbal Bitters
entries: On a success or higher on a Harvest journey activity, you can collect ingredients and brew two servings of a bitter drink that is potent for 24 hours. Imbibing a serving takes an action and reduces fatigue by one level for 4 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Huntsman
entries: You gain advantage on Gather Component journey activity checks.

optionalfeature.name: Longwalker
entries: When you would gain a level of fatigue during a journey, you do not gain that level of fatigue. Alternatively, you can choose to accept the level of fatigue, allowing up to two traveling companions to forgo gaining a level of fatigue instead. Once you have used this feature, you cannot do so again for a week.

optionalfeature.name: Master Tracker
entries: You can spend 5 minutes looking at a 30' diameter outdoor area to study the ground and other clues. You learn all events which transpired in that area in the last 24 hours as though you had witnessed them yourself, although you do not learn secret information not obvious to an observer. The information you gain is only that which would be learned by sight; you do not gain sound-based information or learn what creatures in the area said to each other.
Once you have used this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Monster Mimic
entries: By imitating how a beast or studied adversary sounds, looks, and moves, you gain advantage on Deception and Intimidation checks made to convince a creature that it is seeing or hearing that beast or studied adversary.

optionalfeature.name: Poisons and Antidotes
entries: After a Gather Components journey activity, you can extract 3 doses of liquid poison (when ingested, a creature makes a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or is poisoned for 1 hour) from poisonous plants you've foraged. Alternatively, using the same plants you can spend an hour making a dose of antitoxin.

optionalfeature.name: Read the Room
entries: By spending 10 minutes observing facial expressions, body language, and vocal intonation, you can detect minute details which give you insight into the creatures within 30' of you. For the next minute, you can direct your focus on any one creature that you can see within 30'. If the creature you choose has an Intelligence of 3 or lower or doesn't speak any language, the creature is unaffected.
You learn the surface thoughts of the creature - what is most on its mind in that moment. As an action, you can shift your attention to another creature's thoughts.

optionalfeature.name: Relentless Pursuit
entries: Once you have successfully picked up the tracks of a creature, you are able to follow those tracks without any need for further checks for a period of up to 7 days.

optionalfeature.name: See the Unseen
entries: Once between long rests you can focus your attention on peripheral sights, sounds, and other signs of unseen passage. For the next hour, you can detect invisible creatures and objects, their location, movement, and actions, and even sense creatures and objects in the Ethereal Plane.

optionalfeature.name: Survivalist
entries: When traveling you may undertake two journey activities per day instead of one. Both activities must be from the following list: Befriend Creature, Gather Components, Harvest, Scout.
